title: Provides that sellers of certain products give written notice to consumers of the availability of devices to prevent tipping and injury to young children
summary: Requires that manufacturers and sellers of certain consumer products place a tipping warning on such products.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          64

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced by M. of A. CUSICK -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of A. BOYLAND,
         MAYERSOHN,  PHEFFER,  TOBACCO, WEISENBERG -- read once and referred to
         the Committee on Consumer Affairs and Protection

       AN ACT to amend the general business law, in relation to requiring  that
         manufacturers and sellers of certain consumer products place a tipping
         warning on such products

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The general business law is amended by adding a new section
    2  399-j to read as follows:
    3    S 399-J. REQUIRED TIPPING WARNING. 1. AS USED  IN  THIS  SECTION,  THE
    4  FOLLOWING TERMS SHALL HAVE THE FOLLOWING MEANINGS:
    5    (A) "COVERED CONSUMER PRODUCT" MEANS ANY:
    6    (1)  DRESSER, BOOKCASE, BUREAU, ARMOIRE, OR SIMILAR FURNITURE DESIGNED
    7  TO STORE, DISPLAY, OR OTHERWISE PLACE ITEMS, THAT IS FORTY-TWO INCHES OR
    8  MORE IN HEIGHT;
    9    (2) TELEVISION WITH A DISPLAY SCREEN THAT IS NINETEEN INCHES  OR  MORE
   10  IN LENGTH;
   11    (3) TELEVISION STAND; AND
   12    (4)  SUCH  OTHER  CONSUMER  PRODUCT  AS  THE CONSUMER PROTECTION BOARD
   13  CONSIDERS APPROPRIATE FOR ACHIEVING THE PURPOSE OF THIS SECTION.
   14    (B) "TIPPING WARNING" MEANS A LABEL, HANGTAG, SHIELD OR PLATE WHICH IS
   15  CLEARLY VISIBLE TO  THE  CONSUMER  CONTAINING  A  NOTICE  REGARDING  THE
   16  TIPPING DANGER CERTAIN CONSUMER PRODUCTS POSE TO CHILDREN AND THE EXIST-
   17  ENCE  OF  SEPARATELY AVAILABLE DEVICES DESIGNED TO ANCHOR, STABILIZE, OR
   18  OTHERWISE REDUCE OR PREVENT PRODUCT TIPPING  AND  ACCIDENTAL  INJURY  OR
   19  DEATH, PARTICULARLY WITH RESPECT TO YOUNG CHILDREN, AS PRESCRIBED BY THE
   20  EXECUTIVE  DIRECTOR  OF  THE  CONSUMER  PROTECTION  BOARD,  IN CLEAR AND
   21  CONSPICUOUS TYPE.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD00534-01-1

       A. 64                               2

    1    2. (A) NO PERSON, FIRM, CORPORATION, OR OTHER LEGAL ENTITY WHICH MANU-
    2  FACTURES OR  ASSEMBLES  COVERED  CONSUMER  PRODUCTS  SHALL  MANUFACTURE,
    3  ASSEMBLE,  SELL, OFFER TO SELL, OR DISTRIBUTE IN THIS STATE SUCH COVERED
    4  CONSUMER PRODUCTS UNLESS SUCH PERSON, FIRM, CORPORATION OR  OTHER  LEGAL
    5  ENTITY  WHICH  MANUFACTURES  OR ASSEMBLES SUCH COVERED CONSUMER PRODUCTS
    6  CLEARLY AND CONSPICUOUSLY AFFIXES TO THE COVERED CONSUMER PRODUCT OR THE
    7  OUTSIDE OF THE PACKAGING IN WHICH SUCH COVERED CONSUMER PRODUCT IS  SOLD
    8  OR OFFERED FOR SALE WITH A TIPPING WARNING.
    9    (B)  NO PERSON, FIRM, CORPORATION OR OTHER LEGAL ENTITY WHICH IS REGU-
   10  LARLY ENGAGED IN THE BUSINESS OF SELLING, OFFERING FOR SALE, OR DISTRIB-
   11  UTING COVERED CONSUMER PRODUCTS AT RETAIL FOR CONSUMER USE, SHALL  SELL,
   12  OFFER  TO  SELL,  OR  DISTRIBUTE IN THIS STATE SUCH PRODUCTS UNLESS SUCH
   13  PRODUCTS CONFORM TO THE REQUIREMENT SET FORTH IN PARAGRAPH (A)  OF  THIS
   14  SUBDIVISION.
   15    3.  (A) WHENEVER THERE SHALL BE A VIOLATION OF THIS SECTION, AN APPLI-
   16  CATION MAY BE MADE BY THE ATTORNEY GENERAL IN THE NAME OF THE PEOPLE  OF
   17  THE  STATE  OF  NEW  YORK TO A COURT OR JUSTICE HAVING JURISDICTION BY A
   18  SPECIAL PROCEEDING TO ISSUE  AN  INJUNCTION,  AND  UPON  NOTICE  TO  THE
   19  DEFENDANT OF NOT LESS THAN FIVE DAYS, TO ENJOIN AND RESTRAIN THE CONTIN-
   20  UANCE  OF  SUCH VIOLATION; AND IF IT SHALL APPEAR TO THE SATISFACTION OF
   21  THE COURT OR JUSTICE THAT THE DEFENDANT  HAS,  IN  FACT,  VIOLATED  THIS
   22  ARTICLE, AN INJUNCTION MAY BE ISSUED BY SUCH COURT OR JUSTICE, ENJOINING
   23  AND  RESTRAINING ANY FURTHER VIOLATION, WITHOUT REQUIRING PROOF THAT ANY
   24  PERSON HAS, IN FACT, BEEN INJURED OR DAMAGED THEREBY. WHENEVER THE COURT
   25  SHALL DETERMINE THAT A VIOLATION OF THIS ARTICLE HAS OCCURRED, THE COURT
   26  MAY IMPOSE A CIVIL PENALTY OF NOT MORE THAN TWO  HUNDRED  FIFTY  DOLLARS
   27  FOR  A  FIRST  VIOLATION AND NOT MORE THAN FIVE HUNDRED DOLLARS FOR EACH
   28  SUBSEQUENT VIOLATION. IN CONNECTION WITH ANY SUCH PROPOSED  APPLICATION,
   29  THE  ATTORNEY  GENERAL  IS  AUTHORIZED TO TAKE PROOF AND MAKE A DETERMI-
   30  NATION OF THE RELEVANT FACTS AND TO ISSUE SUBPOENAS IN  ACCORDANCE  WITH
   31  THE CIVIL PRACTICE LAW AND RULES.
   32    (B)  NO PERSON, FIRM, CORPORATION OR OTHER LEGAL ENTITY WHICH IS REGU-
   33  LARLY ENGAGED IN THE BUSINESS OF MANUFACTURING,  DISTRIBUTING,  SELLING,
   34  OR  OFFERING  FOR SALE COVERED CONSUMER PRODUCTS SHALL BE DEEMED TO HAVE
   35  VIOLATED THE PROVISIONS OF  THIS  SUBDIVISION,  IF  SUCH  PERSON,  FIRM,
   36  CORPORATION  OR  OTHER LEGAL ENTITY SHOWS BY A PREPONDERANCE OF EVIDENCE
   37  THAT THE VIOLATION WAS NOT INTENTIONAL AND RESULTED  FROM  A  BONA  FIDE
   38  ERROR  MADE  NOTWITHSTANDING  THE  MAINTENANCE  OF PROCEDURES REASONABLY
   39  ADOPTED TO AVOID ANY SUCH ERROR.
   40    4. THIS SECTION SHALL NOT  APPLY  TO  THE  SALE  OF  COVERED  CONSUMER
   41  PRODUCTS SOLD OR OFFERED FOR SALE BY CONSUMERS FOR CONSUMER USE.
   42    S 2. This act shall take effect on the one hundred twentieth day after
   43  it  shall have become a law, provided that the executive director of the
   44  state consumer protection board is immediately authorized  and  directed
   45  to  promulgate,  amend and/or repeal any rules and regulations necessary
   46  to implement the provisions of this act on its effective date.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the general business law, in relation to requiring that manufacturers and sellers of certain consumer products place a tipping warning on such products
